[[Statistics]] |nationality = [[Australia]]n |doctoral_students = |known_for = }} '''Christopher Charles "Chris" Heyde''' [[Member of the Order of Australia|AM]] (April 20, 1939, [[Sydney]] – March 6, 2008, [[Canberra]]) was a prominent Australian [[statistician]] who did leading research in [[probability]], [[stochastic processes]] and [[statistics]]. Heyde was a professor at [[Columbia University]], the [[University of Melbourne]], [[CSIRO]], [[University of Manchester]], [[University of Sheffield]], [[Michigan State University]], and [[The Australian National University]], [[Canberra]].Joe Gani and Eugene Seneta, [http://webee.technion.ac.il/people/adler/heyde-obit.pdf Obituary: ''Christopher Charles Heyde AM, DSc, FAA, FASSA''], ''Journal of Applied Probability'', vol 45, pp.587-592 (2008)Paul Glasserman and Steven Kou, [http://www2.gsb.columbia.edu/faculty/pglasserman/Other/conversation.pdf "A conversation with Chris Heyde"], ''Statistical Science'', 2006, vol 21, No. 2, pp 286-298.[http://www.columbia.edu/cu/cap/ CAP], Center for Applied Probability at Columbia University[http://www.stat.columbia.edu/misc-pages/Chris.html Christopher C. Heyde 1939 - 2008], Department of Statistics, Columbia University In 2008, Heyde died of [[Metastasis|metastatic]] [[melanoma]]. ==Honours== * 1972 - Member of the [[International Statistical Institute]] * 1973 - Fellow of the [[Institute of Mathematical Statistics]] * 1977 - [[Fellow of the Australian Academy of Science]] (FAA) * 1981 - Honorary Life Member of the Statistical Society of Australia Inc. (SSAI) * 1988 - Awarded the Statistical Society of Australia's Pitman Medal[http://www.statsoc.org.au/Awards.htm Awards], Statistical Society of Australia Inc. and served as President of the Society * 1994 - Shared the [[Australian Academy of Science]]'s [[Hannan Medal]] with [[Peter Gavin Hall|Peter Hall]]. * 1995 - [[Thomas Ranken Lyle Medal]] of the Australian Academy of Science.[http://www.science.org.au/awards/awards/lyle.html Thomas Ranken Lyle Medal], [[Australian Academy of Science]], retrieved 2010-06-06. * 1998 - D.Sc. ''honoris causa'', [[University of Sydney]] * 2003 - Fellow of the [[Academy of the Social Sciences in Australia]] (FASSA) * 2003 - Appointed [[Member of the Order of Australia]] (AM) "for service to mathematics, particularly through research into statistics and probability, and to the advancement of learning in these disciplines".{{cite web | title =Heyde, Christopher Charles, AM | publisher =[[Government of Australia]] | work=It's an Honour | date = 26 January 2003 | url =http://www.itsanhonour.gov.au/honours/honour_roll/search.cfm?aus_award_id=1042199&search_type=simple&showInd=true | accessdate = 2008-03-17 }} ==Offices held== * Vice President of the International Statistical Institute * President of the [[Bernoulli Society for Mathematical Statistics and Probability|Bernoulli Society]] * Vice President of the [[Australian Mathematical Society]] * Editor of the ''Australian Journal of Statistics'' * Editor of ''Stochastic Processes and Their Applications'' (1983–1989) * Editor-in-chief of ''Journal of Applied Probability'' (1990–2008) * Editor-in-chief of ''Advances in Applied Probability'' (1990–2008). ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * {{MathGenealogy|id=57372}} * [http://www.science.org.au/fellows/memoirs/heyde.html Memoir] full transcription from ''Historical Records of Australian Science, vol.20, no.1, 2009'' {{Authority control}} {{Persondata | NAME = Heyde, Chris | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Australian mathematician | DATE OF BIRTH = 20 April 1939 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Sydney]], [[Australia]] | DATE OF DEATH = 6 March 2008 | PLACE OF DEATH = [[Canberra]], [[Australia]] }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Heyde, Chris}} [[Category:Probability theorists]] [[Category:Australian statisticians]] [[Category:Australian academics]] [[Category:Members of the Order of Australia]] [[Category:1939 births]] [[Category:2008 deaths]] [[Category:Fellows of the Australian Academy of Science]] [[Category:People educated at Barker College]]
